net.proteusframework.core.automation

Interface Task

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DataConversion
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataConversion, AbstractTask, DatabaseObjectConversion, SQLDataConversion

    public interface Task
    Task definition. Tasks should not be run with pending data conversions. In general tasks probably depend on an up to date schema and data. NOTE: If in the future tasks are defined that do not depend on the database, add a method to indicate the task can be run with pending data conversions and update implementations to consider the result of the method.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        List<? extends Loggable> execute(TaskArgument[] arguments)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                        SQLException,
                                        RuntimeException
        Execute the task using the specified arguments. Some tasks such as DataConversions, will execute SQL statements. Other tasks may do things, like send an email in which case they will not return SQL statements.
        Parameters:
        arguments - the arguments.
        Returns:
        an ordered list of loggable items from the task. If these are SQLStatements, the will be executed. Return an empty list if there or no loggable items.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the arguments are invalid.
        SQLException - if a SQL Exception occurs.
        RuntimeException - if an error happens during execution.

      • getAdditionalArguments

        @Nonnull
List<TaskArgument> getAdditionalArguments()
        Get additional arguments required by this Task.
        Returns:
        the arguments. These arguments may be modified. Implementations should return a new set of arguments for each call. Each argument should have a unique name.

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Get the description.
        Returns:
        the description.

      • getIdentifier

        String getIdentifier()
        Get the identifier.

        This should correspond to some aspect of a codebase or module. For i2rd library code, this usually corresponds to the name of the module.

        Returns:
        the identifier.

      • validateArguments

        @Nonnull
Map<TaskArgument,String> validateArguments(TaskArgument... arguments)
        Validate arguments.
        Parameters:
        arguments - the arguments to validate.
        Returns:
        a mapping of errors for the arguments.
